Historical Water Use Data
=========================

Historical Average Daily Water Consumption & System Information
---------------------------------------------------------------

| Calendar Year | Average Daily Water Consumption | Maximum Daily Water Consumption | Date |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| 2002 | 1,588,000 Gallons | 2,288,000 Gallons | May 22, 2002 |
| 2003 | 1,688,000 Gallons | 2,500,000 Gallons | August 8, 2003 |
| 2004 | 1,682,000 Gallons | 2,354,000 Gallons | August 16, 2004 |
| 2005 | 1,765,000 Gallons | 2,499,000 Gallons | June 30, 2005 |
| 2006 | 1,780,000 Gallons | 2,681,000 Gallons | June 15, 2006 |
| 2007 | 1,759,000 Gallons | 2,674,000 Gallons | September 9, 2007 |
| 2008 | 1,923,000 Gallons | 2,730,000 Gallons | July 9, 2008 |
| 2009 | 1,936,000 Gallons | 2,877,000 Gallons | June 24, 2009 |
| 2010 | 1,932,000 Gallons | 2,589,000 Gallons | May 28, 2010 |
| 2010 | 2,123,000 | 3,210,000 Gallons | August 12, 2011 |

List of Ten Largest Water Customers
-----------------------------------

Based on 2011 annual usage.

| Customer | Annual Usage in Gallons |
| --- | --- |
| Texas Department of Criminal Justice | 224,393,000 |
| IAH Detention Center | 28,710,000 |
| Memorial Medical Center | 14,446,000 |
| Livingston ISD | 12,761,000 |
| Camp Cho-Yeh | 9,021,000 |
| Pine Hill Apartments | 7,783,000 |
| County of Polk | 6,542,000 |
| The Bradford at Brookside | 3,638,000 |
| Wal-Mart | 3,434,000 |
| Pine Ridge Health Care | 2,356,000 |
